item.title: A.F. add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: A.F. add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: A.F. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: A.F. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The public is wonderfully tolerant. It forgives everything except genius." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: A.F. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: A.F. add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "What I look forward to is continued immaturity followed by death." -- Dave Barry

item.title: A.F. add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification but through fidelity to a worthy purpose." -- Helen Keller

item.title: A.F. add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don’t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first." -- Mark Twain

item.title: A.F. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Nothing travels faster than the speed of light, with the possible exception of bad news, which obeys its own special laws." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: A.F. add a quote by Tom Upton
item.description: "I really should come with a warning label." -- Tom Upton

item.title: A.F. add a quote by Tom Upton
item.description: "I have never been reduced to begging somebody to leave me alone, but in your case I’ll make an exception." -- Tom Upton

item.title: A.F. add a quote by A.F. Stewart
item.description: "Sulphurous wind gusted in his wake; the dust of the street swirled and the folds of his black coat flapped against his thin body." -- A.F. Stewart

item.title: A.F. add a quote by Bruce Lee
item.description: "Adapt what is useful, reject what is useless, and add what is specifically your own." -- Bruce Lee

item.title: A.F. add a quote by Bruce Lee
item.description: "Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them." -- Bruce Lee

item.title: A.F. add a quote by Michael K. Bialys
item.description: "The Worst thing that Good could do to Evil was ignore it..." -- Michael K. Bialys

item.title: A.F. add a quote by J. Conrad Guest
item.description:
"Love is not like a forest fire that burns intensely, hotly and out of control for a brief moment until, its expendable fuel spent, it sputters, seeking in vain for something else to consume, to sustain itself before, finally, it dies: cold, black ash the only evidence of its passing.
Love is, instead, a campfire. It provides ample warmth and comfort to those who sit around it. And although its flames may at times wane, a well-tended campfire’s embers can be nurtured and fanned, until the flames once again dance brightly and cheerfully, providing comfort to those who care enough to cherish the gentle warmth it ministers.
J. Conrad Guest" -- J. Conrad Guest

item.title: A.F. add a quote by A.F. Stewart
item.description: "The stars sparkled above the mist shrouded tents and caravans of the carnival. The night crackled with an odd vibration, as if a veil of peculiarity settled over the company." -- A.F. Stewart

item.title: A.F. add a quote by A.F. Stewart
item.description: "I look at the others, simpering courtiers and visiting dignitaries, all unsuspecting of what is to come. A merciful man should spare them, but I had mercy cut out of me at a young age." -- A.F. Stewart

item.title: A.F. add a quote by A.F. Stewart
item.description: "Shine and shimmer my Harvest Moon, illuminate the shadows in the sky." -- A.F. Stewart

item.title: A.F. add a quote by A.F. Stewart
item.description: "She holstered her weapon, raising the hem of her skirts and stepping lightly around the dead bodies." -- A.F. Stewart

item.title: A.F. add a quote by A.F. Stewart
item.description: "Follow those rats! They may lead us back to Muggins!" -- A.F. Stewart

item.title: A.F. add a quote by A.F. Stewart
item.description: "You’ll have to do better than that chaps, if you want to kill me!" -- A.F. Stewart

item.title: A.F. add a quote by A.F. Stewart
item.description: "As they walked, it seemed almost every building had some similar contrivance as decoration, adorning the street in a cacophony of clangs, bangs and whirs. The street’s surroundings danced with steam and smoke, the scent of oil and grease its perfume." -- A.F. Stewart

item.title: A.F. add a quote by A.F. Stewart
item.description: "She gritted her teeth. <i>The man dances like a clod. I’d rather dance with Mr Jenkins, who can barely move.</i>" -- A.F. Stewart

item.title: A.F. add a quote by A.F. Stewart
item.description: "I’m Detective Piper of the Fairyland Metro Police, and I've been called in to investigate the incident of the missing frog prince…" -- A.F. Stewart

item.title: A.F. add a quote by A.F. Stewart
item.description: "I marched to the head Elf. “Where’s the frog?" -- A.F. Stewart

item.title: A.F. add a quote by A.F. Stewart
item.description: "Yes sir, the fish was left in place of the crystal ball. It's been bagged and tagged for analysis.” Great. Now we have another red herring on our hands." -- A.F. Stewart
